Job Title: Risk and Compliance Specialist

Location: Kansas City, MO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
RISK AND COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST 

The Risk and Compliance Specialist is part of the Risk Management team, and is responsible for implementing and monitoring risk mitigation programs. Ensures responsible parties maintain proper insurance coverage, bonds, and related requirements. Assists in the interpretation/resolution of insurance and bond requirements/issues.

Review and edit a variety of contracts related to the construction industry, including agreements for professional services, confidentiality, and subcontractor arrangements. Assist with managing the contract review process and manage inputs and analysis of contract tracking.

The Risk and Compliance Specialist will report to the Director of Risk Management.

Duties And Responsibilities

Manage a high volume of contracting complexities requiring strategic thinking, problem solving, communication, and prioritization skills.Review subcontract documents for insurance/bond requirements and obtain appropriate certificates of insurance from vendorsReview vendor insurance certificates, endorsements, and bonds to ensure requirements of contract documents are metCommunicate with project teams, subcontractors, brokers and carriers to resolve document deficienciesMonitor vendor insurance certificate insurance renewalAssist with bond trackingManage insurance renewal each year in conjunction with the Director of Risk Management

Knowledge And Skills

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to connect with people in diverse backgroundsExcellent communication (written and verbal) and listening skillsProven ability to work effectively in a team environmentLeadership potential with a willingness to take initiative and drive resultsProven ability to meet deadlinesIntermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft, Google, Excel, Word and other Office applicationsStrong attention to detail and ability to multi-taskSome risk management experience in the construction industry is helpfulInterpretation of contractsVista/Viewpoint or similar construction software preferred

Basic Qualifications

5 years’ experiencePreferred Bachelor’s Degree or Paralegal Certificate

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
